definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: He got a whole sackful of letters from listeners following the show.
sentences.chinese: 演出后他收到大量的听众来信。

sentences.english: I was gratified at the attendance to my talk, and the enthusiastic response.
sentences.chinese: 听众对我的发言予以热烈的响应，令我深感荣幸。

sentences.english: The audience ate up everything he said.
sentences.chinese: 听众们聆耳恭听他所说的每一句话。
古典音乐的听众年纪可能大一些。

sentences.english: Hello. Welcome to American Cafe. I'm Jody. So, Yang Chen, this is a big.
sentences.chinese: 各位听众好，欢迎到美语咖啡屋，我是杨晨。

sentences.english: He turned to the audience with an embarrassed sigh.
sentences.chinese: 他转向听众并发出了窘迫的叹息声。

sentences.english: Most of the audience left before a speaker finishing his speech in a meeting room.
sentences.chinese: 一位演讲者还未讲完，大多数听众就已离开大会议室。

sentences.english: They didn't exactly count noses, but the audience numbered at least five thousand.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有精确地清点人数，但听众至少有5000人。

sentences.english: The pianist made a conquest of every audience for which she played.
sentences.chinese: 这位钢琴家以她的演奏征服了每一位听众。

sentences.english: There was a large appreciative audience in the theatre .
sentences.chinese: 剧院里坐满了有欣赏力的听众。

sentences.english: The enchanted young listeners in Central Park are proof of that.
sentences.chinese: 在中央公园心醉神迷的小听众就是最好的证明。

sentences.english: It ignores one’s audience and waters down your message.
sentences.chinese: 它忽视了听众，也把要传达的信息大大冲淡。

sentences.english: The whole audience rose as the Chancellor and the Ambassador walked onto the rostrum and took their seats.
sentences.chinese: 全体听众起立，彭定康校长和刘大使走上主席台落座。

sentences.english: The audience even crooned to the rhythm of the songs.
sentences.chinese: 台下的听众跟着歌声低声吟唱。

sentences.english: The words of the speaker sank into the mind of his hearers.
sentences.chinese: 演讲者的话在听众脑中留下极深刻的印象。

sentences.english: In a low-context culture , the words used by the speaker explicitly convey the speaker's message to the listener.
sentences.chinese: 在低语境文化中，讲话者详尽地向听众传达信息。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
